page.title: 11The Church,Ravensthorpe cont
page.content: The bells of Saint Denys church call us to worship every Sunday.Holy communion is celebrated at 8am or 11am, alternately there is morning prayer with a special version once a month for families about 30 - 40 people attend. There are about 16 children of 3-11 years in the Sunday School and they support a project in Bangladesh.The church is financed by subscription of its' members,legacies and social occaasions.About 2500 pounds is sent to Peterborough yearly towards the vicar's stipend.For the past 20 years we have shared a priest with East Haddon and Holdenby but the living is vacant just now.This means that the organisation is done by the PCC and retired or visiting clergy take the services.A modern vicarage stands next to the church and the vicar plays an important part in the life of the church.
